items.name: Amateur Dance
items.desc:
Amateur Dance
Range: Augment
Style: Double Dry Hopped Double India Pale Ale
ABV: 8.1
We’ve developed a real taste for going big here at Polly’s HQ, and we’re sating our taste once again with Amateur Dance. Our owner Sean has taken the lead on this one, employing his pyramid dry-hopping technique to full effect in this maxed out, full on DDH DIPA. Mosaic is the dominant hop varietal with a huge 30kg added, before progressively smaller additions of El Dorado and Simcoe accentuate and give this beer multiple levels of depth. Named in honour of his soundtrack for when he works into the small hours to ensure our brewers have as stress free a brew day as possible, this huge beer absolutely drips with dank, stonefruit, mango and pineapple notes, before being reeled back in by a hearty pine finish for balance.

items.name: Deluxe Edition
items.desc:
Deluxe Edition
Range: Augment
Style: India Pale Ale
ABV: 7.0%
El Dorado is one of our favourite hops at Polly’s HQ and for good reason. Back once again for its third iteration and in our opinion getting better each time, Deluxe Edition is our celebration of all things El Dorado; a varietal with a backstory as mysterious as the mythical city it’s named after. With an aroma of ripe mango, papaya and, in our brewers opinion, Jelly Tots (yes, really), it tricks a drinker into believing they’re in for a hype juice explosion. By the time it hits the palate, all of those amazing citrus notes we love so much come to the fore and an all out attack of pithy bitter notes rock up to the party.
A single hop, maxed out hop bill in tribute to one of our favourite varietals; El Dorado, we salute you.

items.name: Ending Chapter
items.desc:
Ending Chapter
Range: Augment
Style: India Pale Ale
ABV: 6.8%
A recent trait of ours has been revisiting some of our favourite Originals range beers and giving them the full Augment treatment. The first version of Citra Columbus was a thing of sheer beauty, and a surefire hint of where things would eventually go with our beers. A pairing of two hugely distinct and classic varietals, both of whom have bold claims to be part of the reason we exist today, this incredible IPA melds everything we love about the old school with the new school hype train we’re proud to be part of. Citra takes the lead on this one with a 20kg dry hop charge, before a follow up of 10kg of Columbus for good measure. The result? An amped up, maxed out IPA full of those juicy tropical notes we love so much, backed up with piney and resinous hoppy notes.

items.name: Fake Attentions
items.desc:
Fake Attentions
Range: Augment
Style: India Pale Ale
ABV: 6.3%
We needn’t remind you that we love all things old school whilst simultaneously melding new school techniques into the beers we create. When designing the recipe for Fake Attentions, we noticed a pattern in that our use of the old school varietals in the dry hop bill was somewhat reserved, with the new school hype hops taking centre stage, and with that, the majority of the sensory notes. We thought “why not flip this one on its head and let an old school hop take the lead?” and Fake Attentions was born. With 20kg of Amarillo leading things alongside smaller additions of Citra, and even smaller additions of Mosaic and Azacca, this beer bursts with punchy orange, and floral notes, before the juice follows up from our new school favourites. Clean, crisp, hoppy, and downright delicious.

items.name: Like, Forever…
items.desc:
Like, Forever…
Range: Augment
Style: Pale Ale
ABV: 5.2%
Ahh, those super sessionable, mega smashable pale ales we love so much. There’s just something about a 5.2% pale ale that makes it perfect as an after work beer. Maybe it’s our fondness of loading them with both new school and old school hops to give that mega juiciness alongside crisp, clean bitter notes that make them so drinkable; whatever it is, there’s just a little bit of magic that happens with our beers when they hit that 5.2% mark.
Like, Forever – named for a remark made in the brewery during a particularly long double canning day – features a ten minute whirlpool addition of Chinook, before adding more again in the dry hop. Paired up with a Polly’s favourite in Simcoe, this beer bursts with passionfruit, apricot, pine and resinous notes.

items.name: Now Here No Where
items.desc:
Now Here, No Where
Range: Augment
Style: DDH Pale Ale
ABV: 5.6%
Vic Secret is a varietal that we feel doesn’t get nearly enough love these days. Pushed out of the way by its more aggressive contemporary Galaxy, we find that this incredible Australian hop has a lot of similarities to its countrymate, but in a much more balanced, easygoing way. We decided to put this thought process into practice with Now Here, No Where – amplifying up the hop bill to that of one of our standard IPAs, whilst keeping things at a relatively sessionable strength. The result is a pale ale that is positively bursting at the seams with pungent tropical pineapple notes. Keeping everything in check with a healthy lashing of in-house favourite Citra, this is a beer perfect for those lockdown Zoom quizzes and Skype pub meetups.

items.name: Patina Effect
items.desc:
Patina Effect
Range: Augment
Style: West Coast Pale Ale
ABV: 5.4%
We’re all self-confessed old school fans here at Polly’s HQ, but our head of sales in particular loves all things West Coast. Constantly chasing those IBUs, we’ve sated his appetite several times over the course of 2020, but every time he’s cheekily told our brewers that we can do better. Upon tasting our latest effort, Patina Effect, we finally got the line we were waiting for – “Lads, you’ve done it”.
Patina Effect is our ultimate homage to the old school American brewers without whom we would not exist today. A reeled back dry hop bill of 15kg of Chinook and 5kg of Simcoe plays those old school floral notes perfectly against the 10kg Chinook whirlpool addition – all the resin, all the bite, but with maximum drinkability. This is Polly’s hitting peak old school.

items.name: Pines
items.desc:
Pines
Range: Augment
Style: India Pale Ale
ABV: 6.4%
A fabled story we love to tell about how we’re constantly learning; when we were working with our amazing pals at North Brewing Co last year, we were astounded at how little whirlpool hops they added in the first stage of the brewing process. Imparting less bitterness is something we’ve been keen to explore in our beers, and we achieved this through bringing the whirlpool temp down, and whirlpooling for much less time and adding smaller additions of Enigma and Mosaic, meaning more hops for dry-hopping! Almost 40kg of Galaxy, Mosaic, and Simcoe ended up going into this beer during fermentation, and the results stand for themselves. An absolute juice bomb of a beer, and a marked improvement on version one of this amazing beer.

items.name: Reality Dysfunction
items.desc:
Reality Dysfunction
Range: Augment
Style: Double Dry-Hopped Pale Ale w/Lactose
ABV: 5.5%
Our staff designed DDH Pale series is certainly gaining some serious traction now, and we’re rolling onto another one in rapid time before we take a short break, with the arrival of Reality Dysfunction – designed entirely by our assistant brewer Matt.
Expressing his love for our lactose-tinged output, Matt brought the mash temperature right down to ensure the beer wasn’t overly sweet, and hit the dry hop up with a bumper dry hop charge of Enigma for a symphony of flavours that dance throughout.
Expect intense amounts of raspberries, passionfruit, and just a smattering of herbal complexity, complimented by the sweetness and full body brought to the table by the lactose addition in the boil. Bravo Matt!

items.name: Shaky Tail
items.desc:
Shaky Tail
Range: Augment
Style: DDH Pale Ale
ABV: 5.5%
Simcoe, Simcoe, Simcoe. Where would we be without you? A strong contender for our in-house favourite varietal purely on the basis of how adaptable it is, we’ve utilized this giant of the brewing scene on single hop showcases across the board, from DIPA to IPA, now it’s the turn of a more sessionable effort, with us loading this DDH Pale Ale with the same dry hop charge as one of our big IPAs, bordering on DIPA territory. Featuring an insane 40kg, and with an ultra light sprinkling in the whirlpool; apricot, passionfruit and citrus notes are positively bursting out of this beer, before being reeled back in with a healthy balance of earthy pine bitterness. With everything wrapped up in a warm hug of our bespoke LA3 yeast strain, this is our love letter to one of the true superstar hops.
